card.description: You are swarmed by angry bees. You must run about frantically trying to avoid them for the duration.
card.acting: Shout in terror and run out the nearest exit, screaming about bees. Refuse to return until they’ve gone.

card.title: Stoned Out of Your Gourd

description.line: You believe you have been turned to stone. You may not act for the duration, nor may you speak.
On the positive side, you are immune to many types of damage.

card.acting: Sit as still as possible without speaking for the duration.

card.title: Slow Motion
card.description: You feel incredibly sluggish. Your movement speed is halved (round down), and any bonus actions count as full actions.

acting.line: Speak to your party very slowly.

description.line: You have sprouted a second head. It will disagree with you and contradict your every thought.
Argue with it. Change your mind on every decision.

card.title: Which End Goes Toward the Enemy?

description.line: You are constantly distracted to the point of dissociation.
Do not add your proficiency bonus to any rolls.

card.acting: Act distracted and exceptionally clumsy.

description.line: Everyone is your servant. Have them do anything you don’t feel like doing.
If they resist, ask them why you pay them at all.
You feel rather inferior to your other companions.
Always pick a fight with the biggest enemy to prove yourself.

card.title: Ritual Madness
card.description: You’ve suddenly developed a rather strange habit. Every time you roll a die, do something strange. You must perform the same action every time you roll.
card.acting: Sneeze loudly. Point at each die rolled 3 times. Scratch a body part in exactly the same place 5 times, counting loudly. Count up to, or down from, the number rolled. Check for your wallet.

description.line: Sometimes you like to think things through. Other times… not so much.
Act Lawful for 1d10 minutes, then act Chaotic for 1d10 minutes. Repeat for one session.
You’re the lead actor of a circus!
Proclaim everything you’re about to do, as if you’re a ringmaster at a circus.

card.title: Goodnight!
card.description: You fall unconscious for the duration. No amount of jostling or damage can wake you.

card.title: Safety Found at the Bottom of a Bottle

description.line: Your character drinks excessively.
To calm their nerves, to calm their shaking hands, to quiet the voices, or to keep the nightmares at bay.
Or any combination of those.

card.acting: Act drunk out-of-game.

card.title: Five-Finger Discount
card.description: If you pick something up, do not give it to your companions. Take any loot that drops.
card.acting: Try to take random items from the other players. Give them back at the end of the session if it is not noticed.

card.title: Younger Sibling Syndrome
card.description: Pick a character in the party. Your character must act like them.
card.acting: Behave like the player who belongs to that character.

card.title: I’m Only Interesting If I Tell Tall Tales

description.line: Bend the truth, exaggerate, or lie about everything.
The more audacious the better.
You have no shame.

card.acting: Exaggerate everything at the table. Tell as many tall tales as you can.

card.title: My Goal Is All That Matters

description.line: Endlessly pursue your personal goals regardless of anything else going on, or your party’s desires.
This may require going alone.

card.title: What Is the Point?

description.line: The color has drained from the world. None of your prior interests hold any excitement. All of your efforts to are doomed to failure.
You have disadvantage on Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws.

card.acting: Speak in a monotone, and appear disinterested in anything going on around you.

description.line: Everyone is silently judging your actions.
Accuse them of it! Act upon it!
Why are they mocking you?

card.title: I am so beautiful … to me! Can’t you see?
card.description: You’re the smartest, strongest, fastest, and most beautiful person you’ve ever known.

card.title: They’re Coming to Take Me Away!
card.description: There are foes chasing you everywhere you go, and they are watching you.

card.title: Just keep swimming, just keep swimming…
card.description: You are compelled to repeat a specific activity over and over.
card.acting: Repeat a task out-of-game.

card.title: Look! A Flying Monkey!
card.description: You experience vivid hallucinations for the duration, and have disadvantage on ability checks.
card.acting: Point out strange sightings to your companions.

card.title: Jet Fuel Can’t Melt Steel Beams

description.line: You suffer extreme paranoia, seeing conspiracies every where you turn.
You have disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws.

card.title: Disgusting! Keep That Away!
card.description: You find something (of your choice, but usually the source of your madness) incredibly revolting, as if affected by the Antipathy spell.

description.line: You experience a powerful delusion.
Discreetly ask your DM for a potion name. You must act as if you are under the effects of that potion.

card.title: My, This Must Be Lucky!
card.description: You become attached to a non-combat item of your choice. You suffer Disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws when over 30' away from it.
card.acting: Bring a nonsensical item everywhere with you. Your chair might be a good place to start.

card.title: I Can’t Hear! I Can’t See!
card.description: Roll a d4. On a 1, you are Blinded. Otherwise, you are Deafened.
card.acting: If you are Blinded, close your eyes and play blind! If you are Deafened, don’t listen to anyone other than the DM.

card.title: “A Boy’s Best Friend Is His Mother”

description.line: You suffer uncontrollable tremors or tics, which pose disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws that involve Strength or Dexterity.
You must also make a Dexterity Saving Throw to cast a spell with Somatic components.

card.acting: Twitch randomly out-of-game.

card.title: Who are you? Who, who? Who, who?
card.description: You suffer from partial amnesia. You know who you are and retain racial traits and class features, but you don’t recognize other people or events prior to your madness.
card.acting: Act like you do not know the other players.

card.title: The Trouble With Mr. Bean

description.line: You have lost your ability to speak.
This includes Verbal spell components

card.acting: Resort to exaggerated facial expressions and frustrated signs to get points across.

description.line: There’s only one person you can trust, and only you can see them.
You have an imaginary friend! Communicate with them regularly and ask for their advice and opinion.

card.title: This Is Hilarious!
card.description: You find it difficult to take anything seriously. The more serious the situation, the funnier it is.

card.title: Oh my God, It Even Has a Watermark

description.line: You really like killing people. And you have developed such a knack for it.
Viciously mutilate your foes and their bodies. Attempt to kill your allies.

acting.line: Profess your undying admiration for Huey Lewis and Phil Collins.
Pontificate on the quality of that fine Chardonnay you’re not drinking.

description.line: Act like a ghost.
Try to pass through walls and scare people.
Sing anything you say.
Every movement you make must be a grand, flourished gesture.

card.title: The Floor Is Lava
card.description: Your character must attempt to avoid the ground, or hop up and down frantically.
card.acting: Don’t touch the floor! (Unless you need to use the restroom. DM’s option to award an Inspiration Point if you manage to make it to the restroom without touching the floor.)

card.title: Cut It Out! Mmmmmmoooommmmm!
card.description: You must mimic the person to your immediate left.

acting.line: Mimic everything the person to your left does.
If you are doing something else, you may ignore this rule for that period, but your character may not.

description.line: You must audibly breathe, taking deep breaths and deep exhales.
If you stop for any reason, the walls begin to close upon you. Make a Constitution Saving Throw or suffer the effects of asphyxiation.

card.title: Is It Safe to Do That?

description.line: You must ask the DM for permission to do anything for the duration.
Anything.

card.description: You must shout a random word that you think of every 10 minutes.

card.title: Drove downtown in the rain …
card.description: The outside world isn’t safe! Retreat within your mind for safety. You are paralyzed for the duration.
card.acting: Do not move for the duration.

description.line: You are under an effect similar to Tasha’s Hideous Laughter, but you make the saving throw at the beginning of each turn.
You may act only if you succeed, otherwise you are incapacitated by laughter.

card.title: Zoiks!

description.line: You’re terrified of demons. And spiders. And people. And that rock over there.
Pretty much everything.
You are Frightened for the duration.

card.acting: Jump in fear (and maybe shout too!) if someone acknowledges you.

description.line: What language did you speak? You’ve forgotten. Time to make a new language.
You are incapable of normal speech (including casting spells that require Verbal components) for the duration, and can only babble incoherently.

card.title: Enemies Are All Around! It’s Not Safe!
card.description: Attack the nearest creature, friend or foe (choose randomly if more than one creature qualifies) each round for the duration.
card.acting: Pretend the other players are monsters or evil villains.

card.title: Look! A Flying Monkey!
card.description: You experience vivid hallucinations for the duration, and have disadvantage on ability checks.
card.acting: Point out strange sightings to your companions.

card.title: You are Getting Sleepy …
card.description: You will do whatever anyone tells you that isn’t obviously self- destructive for the duration.
card.acting: Do what you are told out-of-game as well, as long as it’s not harmful.

card.title: That Looks Rather Tasty…
card.description: For the duration, you have an all-consuming urge to eat something strange, such as dirt or slime for the duration.
card.acting: Ask the player next to you if you can eat their pencil, or dice, or character sheet.

card.title: Goodnight!
card.description: You fall unconscious for the duration.
card.acting: Slump over on the table, unresponsive.

description.line: We are just pawns in a game of giants! They leave our fates up to the dice! Look above you! Do you not see them?
You are convinced that this is just a tabletop game played by giant people.

card.title: It Puts the Lotion on the Skin
card.description: You keep trophies of your vanquished enemies and turn them into adornments.
card.acting: Keep dice that rolled well as trophies. Try to collect both yours and others.

card.title: A Nice Chianti
card.description: The flesh of intelligent creatures is delicious! You feel an overwhelming urge to eat them. Your enemies are the ideal meal, but your compatriots will do in a pinch.
card.acting: How long can you go before the table realizes it’s a Hannibal Lecter impression?

card.title: The Strange Eden of the Hyborian Age
card.description: You degenerate into beastly behavior, seeming more like a wild animal than a thinking being. You lose higher-order skills and abilities, and are only able to make raw Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution checks without proficiency.

card.title: With a Halo of Singing Birds
card.description: When you take damage, you must make a Wisdom Saving Throw, or suffer effects similar to a Confusion spell, lasting 1 minute.
card.acting: When anyone touches you, your character sheet, dice, or any other possessions, act disoriented and confused.

card.title: They’re After Me Lucky Charms!
card.description: Everyone wants to steal your belongings. You get violent if anyone touches anything belonging to you.
card.acting: Accuse anyone who touches your stuff of trying to steal it. Be liberal with the definition of “your stuff.”

card.title: (Wo)Man of La Mancha
card.description: You are granted a vision showing you the way out your larger predicament for you and your compatriots. Anyone who disagrees or says otherwise is intentionally misleading you, and your new flock.
